We propose here one model for a national public radio
system which we believe would be useful and important
to test.
Ill The Program Service
The planning group felt that the exact nature of
the program service necessarily must be determined by
the staff of the system in the first instance with
the key stations as advisors.
However, there was general agreement on the
following principles or objectives:
1) Program Content: As stated earlier the
emphasis would be on analysis and commentary regarding
international and national issues and events,supplemented
by good talk presentations, performances, actualities such
as hearings, U.N. sessions, and key meetings across the
world, and experimental productions in sound and drama.
The purpose of the model system would be to develop new
radio personalities, producing and creative talent as
well as to develop and present programming in keeping with
contemporary interests, changing tastes, and needs.
2) Source of Production: The international resources
of the new radio combine of the BBC, CBC and ABC
(Australia) would be used. We would hope that, as this
public radio system grew, it would become associated with
this new combine, which is presently in search of an
American partner. This would fill an important need for
the combine and assure serious American participation in
the world's first English language network - a participation
of substantial significance to the U. S.
